components.content: Based on the information provided a licence is not required for the activity.

You indicated your intent to place a marker which will be in place less than 24 hours.Based on the information provided your activity is one that meets the terms of an marine licence exemption and a marine licence is therefore not required. This exemption does not require any action from you before it is undertaken.

Based on the information provided your activity is one that meets the terms of an marine licence exemption set out in Article 7 of the Marine licence (exempted Activities) Order and a marine licence is therefore not required. This exemption does not require any action from you before it is undertaken.

Based on the information provided your activity is one that meets the terms of an marine licence exemption set out in S75 of the Marine and Coastal Access Act and a marine licence is therefore not required. This exemption does not require any action from you before it is undertaken. Note: This exemption does not permit the disposal of dredged material at sea. Disposal of dredged material at sea by means other than plough or agitation dredging requires a marine licence.
Based on the information provided the activity does not require a marine licence from the MMO but you may require a marine licence from the relevant devolved administration.

Based on the information provided the activity requires a licence. No exemption is available and the activity is not suitable for self-service licensing.

Apply for a marine licence

items.text: On or under the sea bed
Construction (including alteration and improvement of existing works)
Deposit of a substance or object
Removal of a substance or object
Deposit or use of an explosive substance or object
Sinking of a vessel or floating container
Maintenance of existing structures and assets
Coastal Protection, drainage or flood defence
An activity carried on wholly under the sea in connection with the construction or operation of a bored tunnel
An emergency activity in response to flood or flood risk
An activity carried on wholly under the sea in connection with the construction or operation of a bored tunnel
Deep sea mining or scheduled works under the Crossrail Act
From a floating container in the sea
From a structure on land constructed or adapted wholly or mainly for the purposes of depositing solids in the sea
Markers, moorings, pontoons and aids to navigations
Scientific research - instruments, associated equipment and tracers
Emergency – safety, pollution response and accident investigation
Vessels – Launching of vessels, rights of foreign vessels, deposits in the course of normal navigation, deposits in the course of aggregate or mineral dredging and dismantling of ships
Miscellaneous - Defence activities, licensed deepsea mining and works authorised under the Crossrail Act 2008
Maintenance of coast protection, drainage or flood defence works
Emergency works in response to flood or flood risk
The Environment Agency or someone on behalf of the Environment Agency
The Coast Protection Authority or someone on behalf of the Coast Protection Authority
Creating, altering or maintaining an artificial reef
Fish or other objects caught and returned in the course of a fishing operation
Coastguard activities - safety purposes and training
Safety directions under the Merchant Shipping Act 1995
Equipment to contain, control or recover oils etc
Marine chemical and marine oil treamtment substances
Discharge of offshore chemicals and oil
Pollution prevention - Activities within Part 6 of the Merchant Shipping Act 1995
Securing the safety of a vessel, aircraft or marine structure
Training for either of the above two purposes
Securing the safety of a vessel, aircraft or marine structure
Training for either of the above two purposes
In exercise of a power under Schedule 3A to the Merchant Shipping Act 1995 (safety directions) by or behalf of the Secretary of State
Compliance with a direction under Schedule 3A to the Merchant Shipping Act 1995 (safety directions)
Avoiding interference with action taken under Schedule 3A to the Merchant Shipping Act 1995 (safety directions)
Remove fouling matter from the surface of the sea or seabed
Markers for European marine sites and conservation zones
Placing a marker that will be in place for less than 24 hours
Placing a marker that will be in place for longer than 24 hours but less than 28 days
Placing a marker that will be in place for longer than than 28 days
